snippet: “I Sing for Freedom,” a South African-inflected a cappella series, stars six women of a certain age, and a cane.
abstract: Performances by South African-inflected a cappella group Thokoza feature both music and banter that is intricate and effortless, despite fact that its six female members have only been singing together since February; group performs Monday nights at Baruch Performing Arts Center.
lead_paragraph: “I Sing for Freedom,” a South African-inflected a cappella series, stars six women of a certain age, and a cane.

headline.seo: The Women of ‘I Sing for Freedom’
headline.main: A Musical Get-Together of New Old Friends
headline.print_headline: A Musical Get-Together of New Old Friends
